Honestly I really think this is useful I lose my pet all the time adventuring and it's really hard Adventure when I die I don't know where I was and then my pets are gone especially my cat my poor cat I lost my orange kitty boohoo me please can we add this it will really make me happy and easier to find my pets
Pigs are one of the smartest animals, about as smart as dogs.
You can currently 'tame' them with a saddle, but it really doesn't feel like taming them. I wish there was a little more with taming them.
They are. All of them are tamed. Every cow, pig, and sheep are domesticated as shown through what they look like.
Tamable Pigs would be great at finding Truffles.
Yeah! And they should also make dogs and cats give meat to even things out even further!
To the guy who said pigs are as smart as dogs, they are actually known to be smarter.
Also add them truffle finding skill >:3
thay will add it when pigs fly

I actually had a similar idea but pigs had a small chance of dropping wings when killed and you can only wear it for a small amount of time and you cant put mending on it and you fly like you would in creative mode.
maybe illigers would sometimes cach them and train them

This could be cool, however because the ravanger only drops a sattel a netural one wouldn't have a drop, as such I think it should be a passive, and run around like other mobs when hit, highlighting how different the nature mob and the pillager version are.
If there are domesticated ravages, it only makes sense that there'd be wild ones too. Good suggestion!
So a buffalo that you can tame and ride?
They are cute... So what? Other animals are cute and do other things in the game. Give the chipmunks a use. No vote.

@Some Animal

I left it blank for its' use. For now, chipmunks are really related to winter, nuts, and seeds. But in minecraft, most seeds can be harvested by players, so there are no possible 'real' needs of chipmunks to use. So, how about just petting them? Why not just have a pet for love?

Or, other people can suggest how chipmunks can be used.
I am very excited of the nuts. Maybe squirrels?
Maybe if you tame a chipmunk, it brings you Sweet Berries every 5-10 minutes.

I've seen it without mods, it was in an ancient city and had glowing green eyes. I don't know what caused it but it was definitely not something that happens often. It was also only there for a second or two and then it teleported away. It was looking directly at me.
It is able to happen but it is incredibly unlikely, it's really just a visual glitch.
agreed i think it great idea and maybe same dog beds as well would be cool

I reckon this could be a good idea. I like the idea of different wolves in different biomes, and maybe if they jump in dyed water their fur gets dyed too?

Dog beds would be so cute.

Well not just solid colors but patterns like the horses. Grey with black back. Brown with white/light undersides. There's tons of wild dogs and colorations to look at besides wolves. Cream/yellow like dingos for mesa/desert biomes. Reddish brown like the African red wolf.

It'd just literally be a re-skin but then they aren't having to "make" a new mob, just recode the original.

I'd imagine it's be a little cleaner than having to replicate what was done with ocelots and cats. (But I wouldn't know)

Dugongs will probably spawn in the Deep Lukewarm Ocean and Deep Warm Ocean.

Dugongs and other endangered species need more awareness!

Adding them in Minecraft could help their conservation.

I believe with the new 1.20 update, dugongs instead of finding buried treasure should instead be able to find suspicious underwater sand when given sea grass or act as an underwater sniffer digging up new underwater vegetation or materials when given sea grass.
